attributes.action: Ban non-recyclable plastic wrappers and coverings found in supermarkets.
attributes.background: Plastic packaging should be recyclable and  recyclable in all locations by funding more recycling bins. It should be possible to recycle ALL plastic packaging with home recycling bins. Greener alternatives should be encouraged with greater incentives/disincentives for businesses e.g. greater tax.
attributes.additional_details: Many packagings are either "not yet recycled" or "only recylable at large supermarkets". Action needs to be made to stop single use packaging in everyday domestic products that aren't recyclable. Recycling must be accessible from the home for every recyclable product to reduce landfill. Recycling is important to buffer environmental impacts and needs to be acted upon quickly as a step in long-term sustainability, whilst greater and more direct changes are made. Let's protect the UK environment!

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603901

attributes.action: Road tax reduction due to standard fuel changes.
attributes.background: It has been proven that E10 produces less emissions it has also been said and proven that petrol vehicles using E10 their miles per gallon has significantly lowered and car efficiency has decreased.
attributes.additional_details:
When a car passes it’s MOT emissions test this means it still is within the correct ranges for regulation and to manufacture standard. These results don’t ever drastically change, however, road tax increases every year yet no change in emissions produced. 
As stated E10 fuel has sufficient evidence that it produces less harmful gasses to pollute the environment, that said this should reflect on petrol vehicle owners road tax yearly.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to reduce taxes on drivers, but we're not sure if you want the Government to reduce Fuel Duty, Vehicle Excise Duty, or something else.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: STOP! the relaxation of regulations for gene-edited and GM crops grown in the UK
attributes.background:
To relax regulations will weaken standards meant to protect human health and the environment". 
People won't be fooled. GM crops are GM crops. Whether they are made with new or old techniques, they can lead to unintended consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Keep the regulations as they are !!! to require that gene-edited crops are treated the same as genetically-modified crops. 
 90% of GM crops that are grown today are engineered to withstand blanket spraying with weedkillers that are harmful to butterflies and frogs and bees, gene-edited crops won't be any different and will cause the same environmental problems.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government's proposals relate to gene editing and not genetic modification. You can read more here: 

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/plans-to-unlock-power-of-gene-editing-unveiled

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Accountability for disgraceful conduct during UK sporting events.
attributes.background: Adding contracts to participate in the viewing and supporting of live sporting events making individuals bind themselves legally to acting maturely, for example zero tolerance to violence, zero tolerance to racism, and promoting a supportive and environment for UK sports events.
attributes.additional_details: It has been an issue for countless years, a large group of people who support the UK in sporting events have acted violently when they ‘don’t get their own way’ a lot of the time, causing serious and unacceptable violence and injury to those around them, and some of the time it has been linked to racism, a prime example being the Euro’s 2020 final. People who act this way, need to be accountable for their actions, and need to be educated on what they’re doing as completely wrong, and not corresponding with living in a society.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about any codes of conduct for spectators are a matter for indiviudal organisers of sporting events, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: Make house building companies accountable for the land they own.
attributes.background: Land on new build housing estates is usually turfed or has minimal landscaping that is not conducive to ecological best practices. Open public areas and other landscaped areas should be designed for communal human use alongside ecological use to rewild land and improve biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details: Many new build estates have large open areas of lawn and other poorly designed gardens that could be much better used to engage people and improve the environment. I propose a rethink in the way that spaces are used and designed. Rather than continuing to use monoculture and planting areas of little ecological value, principles of rewilding, permaculture and mycology can be bought into an urban design setting to improve the land over time rather than continue the trend of nutrient removal.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as a change to planning rules.

attributes.action: Stop selling protected greenfield land for cheap to building companies
attributes.background: Stop the sale of 2400acres of greenfield land to building companies for urbanisation
attributes.additional_details:
Stop the declassification and sale of greenfield land to big businesses 

The government has declassified 2400 acres of greenfield land ready for sale to large building companies under the guise of "affordable housing" this land should be protected not urbanised.

Large companies have no intention of protecting any of these environments or conserving or eco building.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not aware of the Government selling any land for development

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban On All Single Use Plastic
attributes.background: We need a ban on all single use plastic e.g. plastic packaging for fruit and veg, plastic bottles, plastic on cans of alcohol, plastic bags in supermarkets. Half of these things end up in land fill sights, oceans and on land in places where animals INHABIT. We need to change before its too late.
attributes.additional_details: We need serious changes to be made to the way in which things are packaged as their are many animals that are being hurt or killed by plastic on land and in oceans (even plastic in our fish we eat). Plastic is ridiculously bad for the environment and needs to be banned urgently. We need change in this country in the way which things are packaged and there are so many alternatives to single use plastic (Recyclable or Biodegradable Plastic, Paper / Cardboard). We can't carry on like this much more

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ban all single-use plastic
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586547

attributes.action: Ban exotic pets
attributes.background: Ownership of exotic animals, not only threatens the general public if they escape, but our delicate ecosystem that is not accustomed to their presence. These animals have their rights abused from being subjugated to artificial, cramped conditions with constant human handling
attributes.additional_details: As a biologist and someone who believes in animal rights, I find it deplorable that a nation such as ours allows the suppression and vile abuse of these often at risk animals. For instance lions and other exotic cats are at risk in their natural environment of the African savanna. I understand there are regulations surrounding the ownership of these creatures. But it is simply not enough. These animals MUST be in their own natural environments, helping their population numbers

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to cover as 'exotic pets' 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as banning the ownership of wild animals currently covered by the requirement for a licence:

https://www.gov.uk/licence-wild-animal

attributes.action: List close family visits as essential reasons for travel
attributes.background: To ask the Government to allow close family visits (parents, siblings and partners) and list them as essential reasons for travel.
attributes.additional_details:
Cognisant of the precaurious situation regarding the spread of Covid-19 throughout the EU and the progress made in the UK, we ask the Government to consider proportionality when it comes to banning travel from European Union countries.

Whilst a ban on international holidays isn't unreasonable, seeing close family members (incl. parents, grandparents, siblings) and partners should not be considered a foreign holiday. Doing so reinforces the hostile environment towards international families.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565102

attributes.action: Allow the sale of clean energy Electrofuel & Biomethane cars as soon as possible
attributes.background: The Government must allow the sale of cars that run on clean energy fuels for example, Electrofuels / Efuels & Biomethane to reduce or even reverse CO2 levels. These cars should be allowed to be sold in order to reduce dependence on Lithium the extraction of which is very damaging to the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Liquid fuels will use a normal fuel pump, with no need for environmentally damaging changes to roads everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates higher co2 emissions, are expensive and will need to be replaced after only a few years.
Cobalt mining is still using Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle thereby reducing carbon levels.
Biomethane is more biodiverse & can be made from waste reducing pollution.
Combustion engine cars are more affordable for those on a lower income.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see more cars running on clean energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Cars that use clean fuels, including non-fossil methane, are already allowed to operate in the UK. You can find out more about what fuels can be used in road vehicles here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/fuels-for-use-in-vehicles-excise-notice-75

attributes.action: Give NHS workers the pay rise they deserve.
attributes.background: The government has proposed a 1% pay rise for our NHS workers who have gone above and beyond for our UK citizens this past year. This is an unacceptable amount and should be reviewed and increased immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Our NHS workers have given their all this past year, risking their lives to treat those with covid on the frontline in an unimaginable environment. The least we can do is to give them the pay rise they deserve. The NHS needs no more hand claps - they need a real increase in wages to continue to support our invaluable National Health Service.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Please give the NHS Covid Heroes a bigger pay rise.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577970

Recognise all members of NHS nursing profession by giving them a 12.5% pay rise
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560253

attributes.action: Make teachers a priority group for vaccination
attributes.background: We would like a separate priority group to be created for teachers to be vaccinated and put them in the highest priority group out of the existing unvaccinated groups in light of schools reopening
attributes.additional_details: Schools are reopening and teachers are unprotected making their workplace an unsafe and high risk environment. Teachers are also key workers on a frontline. They are putting their lives at risk as they have to sit in enclosed spaces with large groups of people. There has already been an unfortunately large proportion of mortality and morbidity in this group

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Prioritise teachers, school and childcare staff for Covid-19 vaccination
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554316

Don’t re-open schools until all staff have been vaccinated
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572419

attributes.action: Legalize cannabis in the UK with a structured business framework.
attributes.background: I would like help to legalize cannabis in the UK in a structured and controlled environment. Being a big be leaver and advocate of CBD products, i truly feel that now is the time to legalize marijuana Not only would this put the UK on the map for new visitors and tourism>>
attributes.additional_details: It would also create jobs and allow businesses to grow. Also allow the UK to create new trade agreements for example: (Jamaica/Caribbean) in order for the products to be grown. Not only would this save costs in relation to Policing the revenue generated by this would benefit the UK and business. You only need to take a look at the framework from Amsterdam / California and other countries to see the benefits of allowing this to happen. This would certainly put the UK in the spotlight all over the world. And also help the people in the trade agreement countries in a positive way.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575625

attributes.action: Wait until the new school year (September) to send all children back to school.
attributes.background: Wait until September to send all children back to school. We have seen from previous cases how quickly the virus can spread in schools and children are the main carriers. It isn’t safe nor morally right to expect students to feel safe in this sort of environment.
attributes.additional_details: If we send children back on the 8th March this runs the risk of cases having a sudden spike again which ultimately means more lockdowns, no summer fun and more stress. Waiting until September gives the government time to sort any underlying issues and makes it truly safe for students whilst also helping their mental health too. No student is feeling safe by going back and there will definitely be a rapid decrease in attendance. Think about students, not just the economy.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572418.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

attributes.action: Restart the current curriculum year this September.
attributes.background:
We would like to the government to seriously consider restarting the current school year in September as the workload being sent out by schools is having a huge impact on children’s Mental Health which is unfair to them due to this pandemic.
Lots of children are having such a tough time with this
attributes.additional_details: The government are the only people that have authority on this, rather than our children suffer more with mental health it would be reassuring to them that this huge issue can be delayed enabling them more time to get back to a classroom teaching environment which is what they all need! Most are suffering with adaptation of high school having hardly spent any time there as yet and now being bombarded with 30+ pieces of work a day! Education is important but Mental Health is much more important.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566160

attributes.action: Enforce compulsory food labels to show the environmental impact of foods.
attributes.background: Enforce a system to notify consumers as to the environmental impacts of products they are buying. This would enable consumers to make informed choices to help them to reduce their own negative impact on the environment while maintaining freedom of choice.
attributes.additional_details: The biggest global challenge of the coming decade is how to reconcile feeding a growing population with protecting precious environmental resources. Given the role of food production in environmental damage, informing consumers as to the impact of different foodstuffs will help steer us towards a more sustainable food system. Labelling as an alternative to banning or taxing products provides this privilege without disadvantaging those without the luxury of choice of food items.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/558188

attributes.action: Enforce the law on engine idling.
attributes.background: Amplified by the lack of passengers, buses idling outside residential properties is rapidly increasing respiratory problems. This is a dangerous pattern - "regulating the service" is not an excuse as bus companies could easily refine the timetables, reduce services and/or replace older engines
attributes.additional_details: The amplification of breathing difficulties is a long term dehabilitating problem that puts increased strain on the NHS over a sustained period. A simple instruction to bus drivers to switch off engines - or better still companies reduce services or replace engines - would pay for itself and save lives, the environment and prevent related mental health issues. This is not really debatable - it's a simple win win situation.

rejection.details: Enforcing legislation on engine idling is a matter for local traffic enforcement officers and the police, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Don't send people back to college and universities until they're vaccinated
attributes.background: Ensure that everyone going back to college or university is vaccinated prior to sending colleges and universities back.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone over the age of 16 is able to receive the vaccine and tend to actually fall ill with the virus rather than just being asymptomatic. They're unlikely to die, however, long covid is a huge problem in young people - a lot of people becoming disabled or losing their senses for months on end. Sending people back to college and university before they're vaccinated is cruel and unfair - especially due to the fact that colleges and universities are environments for superspreading.

rejection.details:
The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency is responsible for approving the safety of vaccines. At the moment, the covid-19 vaccines have only been approved for over 18s.

The Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation have said that "there is very limited data on vaccination in adolescents, with no data on vaccination in younger children, at this time." You can find out more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/priority-groups-for-coronavirus-covid-19-vaccination-advice-from-the-jcvi-30-december-2020/joint-committee-on-vaccination-and-immunisation-advice-on-priority-groups-for-covid-19-vaccination-30-december-2020

We could accept a petition calling on the Government not to allow university students to return to campuses until they have been vaccinated.

You could also start a new petition asking for the government to fund research into the safety of covid-19 vaccines for children, if that's something that you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Allow students to keep cameras off during online school
attributes.background: Allow students to choose whether they have their camera on or off during online school.
attributes.additional_details: Pupils can film other pupils with out consent whilst their camera is on. Pupils feel as though they are being invaded of privacy by having their camera turned on. Many students are raised in different environments within their households whether that be, siblings fighting, parents arguing, or just the look of their home in the background compared to wealthier pupils. Some students share rooms with siblings and their bedroom is considered their only place of privacy. I also think it is distracting when people within my class have their cameras on.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for individual schools and teachers.

attributes.action: Ensure a safe and clean environment for Asylum Seekers in and around Yarl’s Wood
attributes.background: Those living in temporary accommodation both next to and in Yarl’s Wood in Bedford as well as near barracks site in Kent need not only a clean, but safe and not overcrowded environment/ accommodation regardless of whether it’s temporary, particularly during the current pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: Those seeking asylum in the UK should not leave their home countries as they are unsafe only to arrive in a “hostile environment” (as said by Mohammad Yasin, MP). They shouldn’t be put into overcrowded and unhygienic accommodation to the point that they feel a hunger strike is necessary (as has happened in the barracks site in Kent) we should be providing these people with safe environments, not in environments that are unsafe and could be especially damaging to the mental health of many there.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about accommodation of asylum seekers in particular areas, as this is an operational matter, not a decision for the Government or House of Commons, but you may wish to sign this petition calling for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571085

attributes.action: Have a national bank holiday week post COVID
attributes.background: Introduce a ‘reverse lockdown’ week once the UK is completely immunised from COVID-19. In this, the hospitality sector in particular will most likely have 3 months revenue from people desperate to get back out and live their social lives again.
attributes.additional_details: Once the country begins to find its feet after the vaccine has been rolled out, everyone will need to blow off steam and will be eager to mingle with people in a social environment. By giving people a free week to socialise and return to normality, it will prevent a binge or influx of not only nightclubs, bars and restaurants being at full capacity from Friday to Sunday, yet also spread the chaos over the course of a week.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Create a one off Bank Holiday on Monday June 21st 2021.

Create UK Bank Holidays on 25th and 28th June 2021 in lieu of Christmas 2020

Make 26th & 27th July 2021 a one off Double Bank Holiday - Christmas in July!

Create extra bank holidays to make up for those that took place under COVID.

Extra Bank Holiday when Covid restrictions are finally lifted

attributes.action: Instigate compulsory wearing of face masks in the public domain during Covid 19.
attributes.background:
This should include when taking any form of exercise externally in public. 
Individuals must provide documentary evidence by means of a non compliance health certificate issued by their G.P. stating that it would cause them further medical complications by having to do so to be exempt.
attributes.additional_details: For the protection of everyone in the general environment by reducing the potential increase spread of all the Covid 19 virus strains and assist the NHS from being further overwhelmed.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554917

attributes.action: Prevent bee killing pesticides from being reintroduced in the UK
attributes.background: Do not allow the UK to go back to using the currently banned Neonicotinoid pesticides on crops, as they are deadly to bees.
attributes.additional_details: We should not use brexit as an excuse to step backward in our environmental policies. These pesticides are lethal to bees and other pollinators which our environment desperately needs to pollinate flora and fauna. Bees alone pollinate 3/4 of all British crops, which makes the use of this pesticide incredibly counter-intuitive. The government claims it is committed to reducing our environmental impact but this would be a massive step back, seriously and permanently damaging the UK’s ecosystem.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Continue the ban on insect-damaging neonicotinoid thiamethoxam on all crops.
attributes.background: We ask that the recent decision to allow the use of the insect-damaging neonicotinoid thiamethoxam on sugarbeet is reversed.  It isn't allowed in the European Union and should not be used here either. We were promised there would be no lowering of environmental standards as part of Brexit changes.
attributes.additional_details:
Bees & other insects are proven to be hurt by neonicotinoids. They are also threatened by climate change & pollution.  
Insects are vital for a healthy environment, including for growing food.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids

attributes.action: Cancel 2022 GCSE & A-Level exams
attributes.background: Too many Year 10 & 12 students have spent less than 30% in a classroom environment in this academic year and will never be ready for 2022 GCSE & A-Level exams, so it is only fair for those exams to be cancelled & a teacher determined grade given.
attributes.additional_details:
Do not put Yr 10 & 12 students through unnecessary stress which would impact their mental health by forcing them to spend their final year, trying to play catch up, where they have missed so much classroom time in 2020 & 2021. Cancel the 2022 GCSE & A-Level exams.
By the time current Year 9 & 11 students start their preparations for GCSE & A-Level exams, we would have been vaccinated & should be back to normal

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566760

attributes.action: For all sectors to be more accountable of Climate Emergency and Sustainability.
attributes.background: To consider amending the Company Act to tighten specific requirements so government and businesses have greater accountability for their operations in respect of the impact on the environment (e.g. s.172 CA).  For the Well-being of Future Generations (Wales) Act 2015  to be implemented in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling on the UK Government to, 
(i) deliver the Well-being of Future Generations (Wales) Act 2015 across the UK and for this to incorporate government departments, private and third sector companies. (ii) for a review of company legislation to assist with the need to reform UK Company law and Governance to assist with the protection of our natural environment and of future generations - particularly the Company Act s.172 so that text is more specific, clear reflecting the urgency today.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the climate and sustainability, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make Ecocide a criminal offence in the UK:  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332264

Require health warnings at point of purchase of fossil fuel energy eg. petrol: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333388

Allocate Government time to debate the Climate and Ecological Emergency Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561245

Introduce a carbon tax: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321854

Require packaging that clearly details the environmental impact of products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844

Require labels on all products showing water and carbon usage in manufacture: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all school and college staff members before they reopen
attributes.background: I would like for the government to prioritise vaccinating teachers alongside the elderly, care home staff and NHS staff.
attributes.additional_details: All staff members at colleges and schools have been risking their health teaching in person during this pandemic. Teachers have been working hard to ensure safety in the classroom but with the current number of cases, it is unfair to make them continue to work in an environment with a high transmission rate without some form of protection, like the vaccine. It would be unfair to ask them to return to teaching after lockdown without it.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Postponing all BTEC exams until its safe
attributes.background: postponing the exams until its safe for both staff and students to conduct their exams in a safe environment
attributes.additional_details: students are under a huge amount of stress as is with there exams and now they need to also worry about covid-19 as well as worrying about keeping there love ones safe at this difficult time

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565615

attributes.action: Stop the Government closing Golf Courses during the lock down.
attributes.background: Allow Golf Courses to open for playing golf during the Lockdown period in a safe and controlled environment.
attributes.additional_details: Golf is played in the open, is good exercise and is helpful towards mental health issues caused during this time. It can be played with social distancing and ALL golf clubs have been practicing excellent safe and controlled environments throughout the year.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Allow golf to be played with appropriate safety measures
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557167

attributes.action: Temporarily suspend fines for children removed from school during the pandemic
attributes.background: Parents and guardians must have the right to decide to keep their children out of school if they feel it is unsafe. It is unfair and unjust to fine those that wish to keep their children, and those their children come into close contact with, safe.
attributes.additional_details: It is the duty, and the right, of all parents and guardians to keep their children safe. SAGE, teaching unions, and teaching staff, are all advising that sending children to school is not safe in the current climate. We do not know enough about how the new variant affects children to be sure that schools are safe environments. Many parents and guardians want to ensure the safety of their children by homeschooling them. It is unfair that these parents may be fined for unauthorised absences.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551740

Since you started your petition the Government has announced that primary schools, secondary schools and colleges across England must move to remote provision from 5 January 2021, except for vulnerable children and the children of key workers.

You can read the Prime Minister's announcement of new Covid-19 restrictions, including school closures, here: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/prime-ministers-address-to-the-nation-4-january-2021

attributes.action: Open community centres and cafes during lockdown for new parents
attributes.background: Community centres and places such as cafes should be open so vulnerable members of society can socialise (distanced of course). This includes new parents, babies and toddlers. We need a place for babies and children to be warm and fed in a warm environment.
attributes.additional_details: Social interaction is vital for development of young people and mental health of parents, especially new parents. Babies also go through normal separation anxiety which is again vital for their ongoing mental health and with a lack of seeing others during lockdown this will have negative effects on them.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want Covid-19 restrictions to be changed, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want to be made.

We could accept a petition calling for community centres and cafes to be allowed to open for certain clientelle, but it would need to be clear who you want to be able to access these venues, and if this would only apply during national lockdowns, or if you want it to apply to all areas during any local restrictions.

attributes.action: To allow soldiers who serve in the British Army to wear neat/trimmed facial hair
attributes.background: The Royal Navy are allowed to grow beards through their tradition. The British Army used to grow beards however that was lost and now they have to parade clean shaven. Growing a beard hugely increases moral (from a survey) and contributes to operational effectiveness through psychological means
attributes.additional_details:
Many Middle Eastern and Indian cultures associated wisdom and power with facial hair. As a result, facial hair and moustaches became increasingly common among British soldiers during the great wars. During the Crimean War, all ranks were encouraged to grow full beards during winter. More recently, the British Army has been seen sporting a full range of stubble, moustaches and beards on Ops to blend in.
Given the current Terrorism Level, it also helps to 'blend in' in a civilian environment

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of all fireworks due to the pollution they cause.
attributes.background: We want the government to act responsibly during this pandemic and ban fireworks sale/use altogether and seek cleaner, safer alternatives. Fireworks cause air pollution-air pollution causes respiritory problems-Covid19 thrives on respiritory problems. This needs done before the festive period 2020.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks cause extensive air pollution in a short amount of time, leaving metal particles, dangerous toxins, harmful chemicals and smoke in the air for hours and days. Some of the toxins never fully decompose or disintegrate, but rather hang around in the environment, poisoning all they come into contact with. The UK government should have already made this decision especially with Covid19 present. Other countries have banned them for this reason, it's time the UK government did also.

attributes.action: To allow public houses to continue to sell alcohol during lockdown.
attributes.background: Public Houses should be able to continue to provide takeaway beer for home consumption during lockdowns.  Many pubs used their ingenuity to sell takeaway beer from windows at the front of the pubs, and with social distancing in place via appointments where necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The hospitality industry has been very hard hit and the ability to provide off-sales during the first lockdown gave a lifeline to many.

Independent free houses have responsible landlords and landladies, who know their customers, environment and can provide safe sales following a risk assessment.

This no only benefits the pubs, but in most cases helps the small independent brewers who already have beer which will otherwise be wasted.

attributes.action: Gyms to remain open during 2nd national lockdown and to be classed as essential
attributes.background: I would plead with the government and the scientific advisory body to allow public gyms to remain open. There is no scientific evidence to suggest that they are part of the spread of coronavirus and are one of the most ‘Covid secure’ environments more so than supermarkets and places of prayer.
attributes.additional_details:
To allow gyms to remain open as winter Is upon us and the ability for the public to train and exercise outside is limited due to the abysmal british weather.

 They are also one of the most important factors in the populations mental and physical health. 

There is no scientific evidence to suggest gyms cause increases in coronavirus and are vital to the morale of millions of people across the country.

I would applaud the government to not baselessly close one of the most important sectors in Britain.

attributes.action: Put water fountains in public to reduce people buying single-use plastic bottles
attributes.background: Putting water fountains in public spaces will mean that people buy less single use plastic bottles. Plastic is destroying our Earth, clogging our oceans and killing our wildlife. Water fountains will let you refill your bottle without polluting the oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic pollution is becoming a big problem (by 2050 there will be more plastic than fish in the oceans). Water fountains in public are common in other European countries - so why aren’t they here? It is a free way for people to save the environment. Placing just one water fountain in a public space could save our Earth and stop polluting our seas. There isn’t a Planet B so we need to do all we can to stop this plastic problem.

attributes.action: Build More Youth Clubs In Haringey
attributes.background: Open Youth Clubs in Haringey
attributes.additional_details: Since 2010 London has lost 104 Youth Clubs, not only has this lead to a dramatic increase in violence but young people have nowhere to go to get the support we need. By reopening Youth Clubs young people will get off the streets and into a safe nurturing environment. This is particularly important due to COVID-19 as young peoples mental health has suffered and not everyone has an effective support system at home. Youth Clubs will provide emotional, social and physical health benefits.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the UK Government or House of Commons are responsible for.

Local services such as youth centres are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

Haringey Council has its own petitions system, which you can find out more about here: https://www.haringey.gov.uk/local-democracy/meetings/petitions

attributes.action: End the mandatory wearing of face masks in schools
attributes.background: To ensure that children and teachers can thrive in the school environment, we ask the government to remove the need for pupils and staff to have to wear a face mask when on school campus. Pupils and staff should be given the right to chose for themselves whether wearing a face mask is necessary.
attributes.additional_details: By imposing the wearing of masks, amongst other authoritarian COVID measures, we are in danger of psychologically damaging the current generation of children in schools. We have already seen children returning home in distress as a result of the COVID measures that schools have been forced to implement. 2020 has been traumatic enough for children, and given the extremely low health risk posed by the school environment, we feel it is only right that the wearing of masks should be a personal choice.

rejection.details:
The Government has not made the wearing of face coverings mandatory in schools in England.

On 25 August the Government updated its advice on face coverings in school, stating that while the government is not recommending face coverings are necessary, schools will have the discretion to require face coverings in communal areas if they believe that is right in their particular circumstances: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/update-on-face-coverings-in-schools

The Government also said it would advise additional measures are taken in areas where the transmission of the virus is high, which will include stating that face coverings should be worn by adults and pupils in secondary schools when moving around the school, such as in corridors and communal areas where social distancing is difficult to maintain.

We have accepted the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Do not make masks mandatory for children in primary or secondary schools in UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332497

attributes.action: Risk assessments for wearing masks for all environments.
attributes.background: To demonstrate with research the effects and benefits of wearing a mask. To accept full personal and commercial liability for anyone who suffers respiratory problems from prolonged mask wearing at work, due to governments guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: I have grave concerns that prolonged mask wearing and their casual disposal will create more problems for people now and in the future.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In particular we're not sure if you're asking for more research into the use of masks, or if you want employers to carry out risk assessments for employees required to wear them.

Employers already have a duty of care under the Health and Safety at Work Act, and are required to carry out risk assessments by the Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulations 1999. You can find more information here: https://www.hse.gov.uk/involvement/riskassessments.htm

You may wish to sign this petition:

Don't make the wearing of face masks compulsory in public places in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331174
            
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Facilitate a voluntary herd-immunity campaign for low-risk British citizens.
attributes.background: Facilitate a service which allows individuals who are of ‘lower-risk’ to volunteer to contract Covid19 in a controlled, medically supported environment in an attempt to establish herd immunity within the general population. Lower risk individuals can potentially help shield those of higher risk.
attributes.additional_details: The current strategies for managing the Covid19 pandemic will require an extended period of disruption to the British way of life. The success of any prospective vaccine is reliant on herd immunity. The British public should be given the option to volunteer themselves to provide this herd immunity sooner if they are of low risk of developing complications. A herd immunity campaign could be facilitated with appropriate medical support e.g temporary hospitals, and measures to ensure containment.

rejection.details:
The World Health Organisation describes 'Herd immunity', also known as 'population immunity', as the indirect protection from an infectious disease that happens when a population is immune either through vaccination or immunity developed through previous infection. It is as yet unclear what level of herd immunity can be achieved against Covid-19 through either vaccination or previous infection.

The World Health Organisation has said that there is currently no evidence that people who have recovered from COVID-19 and have antibodies are protected from a second infection, and we cannot publish petitions that are based on false or unproven assumptions.

attributes.action: Change the A-Levels 2021 for students, allow Year 12s to have a say in this.
attributes.background: A-Levels 2021 should have more changes. We need our exams to be altered to fit our needs after lockdown, whether thats making them easier, shorter, or cutting out certain topics. Delaying the exams by a few weeks does not make up for multiple months of school missed, we need change to the exams.
attributes.additional_details: Year 12s have missed 40% of the academic year and many students have struggled in lockdown, whether thats due to mental or physical health, not having a suitable environment, or the massive amount of content we have to learn. A-Levels are much harder than GCSEs and they are very important qualifications that we need for University or other pathways. Our results will be significantly impacted by this epidemic, and we need something to be done about it. WE need a say in what happens to us.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament. 

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570

attributes.action: Full accountability and monitoring of waste collection for recycling
attributes.background: A recent and previous BBC investigations found the UK are exporting recycling to countries that are unable to process their own waste, yet alone that of other countries. Some if not the majority is destroying the local communities and ending up in landfill or being burned or dumped into waterways.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government and councils have a duty to process waste in a responsible and environmentally conscious way, we cannot pass on this responsibility. If waste is to be exported (to the detriment of the environment) then stringent processes should be in place to ensure its final destination is a legitimate and monitored recycling facility or scheme. 

The UK public have diligently separated waste for recycling for many years. We demand that our efforts are actually making a positive difference.

attributes.action: Ban UK Police from using horses in demonstrations and protests.
attributes.background: Horses are not a form of crowd control nor a battering ram. I'm urging the UK Government to instruct U.K police forces to ban the presence of horses at protests and demonstrations. By using horses for this purpose, the police are mistreating these animals and are putting lives at risk.
attributes.additional_details: As protests arise to combat issues regarding race inequality and police brutality, police forces in the UK are using horses in a hostile manner in an attempt to control these gatherings. As seen in the London BLM (Black Lives Matter) demonstrations (06/05/20), the police unnecessarily brought these sentient animals into a stressful and uncomfortable environment. During the protest a spooked horse panicked and charged towards the crowds, knocking over and risking the lives of both police and protestors.
